intro: Nasturtium eustylis, commonly known as the slender nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Tropaeolaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its stems are often covered in fine, soft hairs. Nasturtium eustylis is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and full sun conditions. It is also valued for its edible flowers and leaves, which have a peppery flavor.
